item.title: I have defended my Phd Thesis
item.description:
I am proud to say that I have defended my thesis, Alhamdulillah. I want to thank my Supervisor Fredrik Heintz for all the support over the years and my co-supervisor Daniel de Leng for all the help. I also want to thank the opponent and the committee members.

I want to thank my family for supporting me during this stressing times. I want to thank my other family members in Sweden (Bangladeshi community people) for your continuous support. Finally, I want to thank all of you who were present during the defense.

Thesis title: Representative Synthetic Data for Fair Decision Making

Link to the thesis:

item.title: PhD Thesis Nailing (Spikning)
item.description:
Nailing (Spikning) is a unique tradition in Sweden for PhD Students. Usually three weeks before the public defense, PhD students nail their thesis in a tree or similar thing to announce their upcoming defense, so people can read the thesis beforehand and participate in the discussion during the defense.

So, on 12 and 15 December, 2025, I had my nailing. I am proud to say that I will have my defense on January 16, 2026. I thank everyone who was there at the nailing ceremony. Special thanks to my supervisor Fredrik Heintz, co-supervisor Daniel de Leng, PhD coordinator Anne Moe, and my group members at Reasoning and Learning Lab (ReaL).

The thesis is online and you can read from here:

And the public defense event:

item.title: Reserach Work Presented at NordicAIMeet
item.description:
I had the pleasure to present my work titled “Representative Synthetic Data for Fair Decision Making” at the Nordic Young Researchers Symposium which held in Norr√∂kping, Sweden on 26-27 November, 2025.

More detaile about the event can be found:

item.title: Close to Final Seminar PhD
item.description:
I had my close-to-the-final seminar of my PhD studies. I am working on Fair Decision Making process using Synthetic data and Fair representation. Beside this, I am also working on Time-Series Generative Models.

Look in to my publications list in Google Scholar:

item.title: Paper Accepted at ECAI 2025
item.description:
Our paper titled Promoting Intersectional Fairness through Knowledge Distillation has been accepted at European Conference on Artificial Intelligence (ECAI), Bologna, 2025.

In this paper, we used Knowledge distillation to handle intersectional bias in decision making process.

You can read the paper from here:

item.title: Attended ICLR 2025
item.description: I had the pleasure to attend the International Conference on Learning Represenataions (ICLR) 2025, in Signapore. It’s a A* (flagship conference) level conference and I had the opportunity to talk with remarkable researchers in the AI field.

item.title: Champion at Swedens Largest AI Hackathon - Hackaping
item.description:
Our team (LiU-AI) become champion at the Sweden’s largest AI hackathon - Hackaping in the Employee scheduling catergory. We developed a solution to aid the scheduling of employee using various strategy including automating the system with AI.

More details:
